comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Zach Lamar Cobb, customs collector in El Paso, see El Paso herald., April 03, 1914, HOME EDITION, Image 1, "TERRITORY FOR BANKS SUITS EL PASOANS", with photo. "Zach Lamar Cobb served as the El Paso Collector of Customs from 1913 to 1918--and as an intelligence agent for the United States Department of State during the Mexican Revolution." (from www.amazon.com/Zach-Lamar-Cobb-Intelligence-Southwestern/...) "Zach Lamar Cobb, the US customs collector there, had built a small intelligence network of his own, including railroad employees. These sources reported Huerta's movements, which Cobb relayed to Washington. Cobb also organized the group that arrested Huerta. Once Huerta was arrested, Wilson ordered the Justice Department to detained him and keep him from returning to Mexico, orders the department followed until Huerta's death in custody from complications of alcoholism. (www.cia.gov/library/center-for-the-study-of-intelligence/...)

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: B-59:  Thanks for the link to more information about Cobb. Looks like the same person.  We will include his full name and occupation information in the description next time we update.
